page.title: 18THE VICAR'S DAY (2nd part)
page.content: Routine visits bring the church to the people and is the most rewarding part of the ministry. Try to be home by 6pm for meal,watch national and local news on TV and read local newspaper. Evening activities vary from Parish Council meetings,services,attend local social functions,Deanery meetings. Because an 'open house' is kept at the vicarage,there is very little free time. The vicar enjoys river fishing so makes the most of an hour or two on the River Lynher during the fishing season, relaxing and contemplating future sermons. Bedtime is usually 10.30pm.
